commitResults.messageBody: Implemented an initial skeletal version of it that simply greets the user and exits.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added Echo function: When user inputs keyboard string, Tank echos string back.
Added the ability to store whatever text entered by the user and display them back to the user using the command "list".
commitResults.messageBody: More than 100 texts are able to be stored.

commitResults.messageTitle: Renamed list to tasks. Functionality of "list" command is preserved.
commitResults.messageBody:
Implemented task tracking using Task class, with ability to mark and unmark tasks as done/not done.

Example input: "mark 1"
Example input: "unmark 1"

Modified text prompts to sound more friendly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Majority changes were done to improve coding standards. - turned dotted lines into constant to remove clutter - extracted certain functions according to SLAP method - fixed variable naming that were not in camelcase - modified main method to switch case instead of multiple if clauses
Applied regression fix to markTaskDone and markTaskNotDone Added checkIndexValidity method to print error message and reject invalid user input Modified greet message
Expanded task feature set by implmenting subclass of Task (Todo, Deadlines, Events).
commitResults.messageBody:
Corresponding constructors, modifications to main method, displaylist method have been updated.

Added help message such that user inputs that do not specify todo, deadline or event do not invoke Task class to be constructed directly by user.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the testing of Tank.
Added exception handling functions that do not terminate Tank instance.
commitResults.messageBody: Invalid commands, invalid inputs and invalid formats will be detected, and Tank will prompt user with appropriate fixes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Added delete Task function. User can now specify for example "delete 2" to delete item 2 in the list.
Resolved bug whereby mark, unmark and delete will cause Tank to fail if number specified is exactly 1 more than the current number of tasks.
Updated HELP_SHEET to include delete function
Added TankException class to use exceptions to handle errors. Corresponding methods have been updated to use try-catch to process exceptions thrown by TankException.
